intro: Wettiniicarpus, commonly known as the African firethorn, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Capparaceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their showy, often red or orange flowers that appear in clusters. They have small, leathery leaves and produce small, capsule-like fruits. Wettiniicarpus species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant flowers and hardy nature.
